page.title: 08The Clubs In Crigglestone.
page.content: In this area there are two clubs, Painthorpe Country Club and the Working Men's Club.Painthorpe Country Club is situated on Painthorpe Lane, this attracts people as it is a nice place for a wedding reception. Although it has expensive prices, many people go there. The Club puts on entertainments and buffets.{W.M.C.}The Working Men's Club on Crigglestone High Street organizes many day trips to sea coasts in the summer. People who go have to have a Club member in the family. To become a member you have to pay a subscription . The W.M.C. also organizes raffles ,has entertainment and local beauty contests. The regulars are usally retired men, some of whom were miners. {The Public Houses}These are the Bay Horse, The Station, Lord Nelson, Gardener's Arms and the British Oak.
